title:
The Relevant Domain of the Hilbert Function of a Finite Multiprojective
  Scheme
abstract:
Let X be a zero-dimensional scheme contained in a multiprojective space. Let
$s_i$ be the length of the projection of X onto the i-th component of the
multiprojective space. A result of A. Van Tuyl states that the Hilbert function
of X, in the case when X is reduced, is completely determined by its
restriction to the product of the intervals $[0, s_i - 1]$. We prove that the
same is also true for non-reduced schemes X.
